title: Practical Development of Integrated Instructional Design-Based Online Science Inquiry Courses

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience. Requires a basic understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formation–experiment design–data analysis–conclusion drawing)
context.additional_context: Focus on job-linked science content development for working professionals, utilizing collaboration tools in BYOD environments. Emphasizes content development reflecting real-world scientific research cases.

learning_goals: Designing an online science inquiry course outline applying the four CEM methodology models (instructional, conceptual, interface, web).

Learners develop 10-minute multimedia learning materials including three hypothesis-testing quizzes and one virtual lab simulation reflecting science domain characteristics (physics laws, chemical reactions, biological variables) and achieve 80+ points on an expert evaluation rubric (content accuracy 20%, interactivity 30%, scientific rigor 50%).

Learners implement an LMS-compatible web prototype (navigation: ≤3-step paths, accessibility: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance) within 3 weeks, achieving ≥80% satisfaction in usability testing (5+ participants). The prototype must include experimental data visualization tools and scientific analysis features.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
